comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; en-US; rv:1.9.2.14) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/3.6.14

@font-face doesn't load correctly (http response status is 206) when using cross domain websites.

Reproducible: Always

Actual Results:  
Font face doesn't work

Expected Results:  
@fontface should be loaded correctly

the solution I found is to embed the font in the actual css file, no in separated files.
comments.creator: matthieu.aussaguel@gmail.com
comments.text:

the solution I found is to embed the font in the actual css file, no in separated files.
comments.author: matthieu.aussaguel@gmail.com
bugzilla@mversen.de
comments.text:
no crash or dataloss=not criteria.
Is the server sending the right http header to allow crosslinking ?
(http://openfontlibrary.org/wiki/Web_Font_linking_and_Cross-Origin_Resource_Sharing )

comments.raw_text: I'm sorry I can't tell now, it's too late. The website is online and I won't be able to play with the bug. As far as I remember, the http header seemed to be correct.
